bibl.title: Tsunetaro Machida v. Henry M. White. Bail Bond
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the United States District Court ofthe Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of Tsunetaro Machida, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

WHEREAS, Tsunetaro Machida, by Thomas R. Horner his Attorney, filed an application in the above entitled court for a writ of Habeas Corpus, which said writ was after hearing discharged by the Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, Judge in and for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, and said petitioner remanded to the custody of the United States Commissioner of Immigration; and

WHEREAS, the said petitioner, Tsunetaro Machida, by his attorneys Thoas R. Horner and Edward Judd, has appealed from said order and judgment, entered on the 26th day of September 1921, to the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit; and

WHEREAS, pending said appeal, the above entitled court has allowed said petitioner to be enlarged upon furnishing a bail bond in the sum of One Thousand Dollars ($1000) secured by Liberty Bonds in a like amount, for the appearance of of the said Tsunetaro Machida in the above entitled court in case said judgment, decision and decree be affirmed;

NOW THEREFORE, know all men by these presents that Tsunetaro Macjida, as principal, and Liberty Bonds in the sum of One Thousand Dollars ($1000) deposited with the Clerk of the Above entitled court, as surety, are held and firmly bound unto the United States of America, in the penal sum of One Thousand Dollars ($1000), for the payment of which well and truly to be made he binds himself, his heirs, executors, adminstrators and assigns, jointly and severally, by these presents.

Sealed with his seal and dated this 26th day of September 1921. THE CONDITION of the above obligation is such that if the above bounden Tsunetaro Machida, shall at all times render himself amenable to the orders and processes of the above entitled court, in case said judgment, decision and decree be affirmed by the United States Circuit

Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, and will appear for judgment in case it be ultimately determined that the said petitioner is not entitled to a writ of Habeas Corpus, and is remanded to the custody of the Commissioner of Immigration at Seattle, Washington, then this obligation to be void; otherwise to remain in full force and effect.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 26th day of September, 1921.
Filed in the United States District Court
